bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 26 (Friday, February 7, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SAN NICOLAS:H.R. 5820.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 of the Constitution,Congress's authority to make rules and regulations respectingthe Territories and possessions.Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution,Congress's authority to make laws necessary and proper forcarrying into execution all other powers vested[Page H977]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

item.fullName: Del. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]
Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

summary.text: This bill authorizes the President to invite each U.S. territory to provide and furnish no more than two statues for placement in National Statuary Hall.

bill.title: To permit the territories of the United States to provide and furnish statues for placement in the national statuary hall.

item.title: To permit the territories of the United States to provide and furnish statues for placement in the national statuary hall.
To permit the territories of the United States to provide and furnish statues for placement in the national statuary hall.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
